page.title: 11THE WOLVERLEY KNIGHT
page.content: SIR JOHN ATE WOOD _________________ {Sir John Ate Wood}was a Wolverley knight who went on a crusade in .... Before he left he gave his wife one half of his ring as a keepsake. He was captured by ............. and imprisoned. {Lady Ate Wood}, believing he was dead made plans to remarry. One day a ragged,filthy man was found by the family dog lying in a meadow near the Ate Wood home.The man said he was Sir John and proved it by showing the matching half of the ring that his wife possessed. The legend says that Sir John was carried home by a{white swan}. An effigy of the knight showing the family dog at his feet and the swan on his helmet is in{St.John's {Church ,Wolverley}.
